column4: hey guys, i just installed ubuntu, and i am trying to install xchat via the "Add/Remove" dialog. when i click the check mark for xchat, it tells me the list of applications is not available, and to click refresh. when i click refresh it seems to download a list (it says "download file 6 of 6") and then processes it, it looks like
but it does this every time i click the x next to xchat
any ideaS?
just open a terminal and type "sudo apt-get install xchat"
i tried that as well, and it says there's no xchat package. i even tried apt-get update, and it doesn't seem to download anything new.
hav eyou modified your source list?
nope
maybe.
open synaptic package manager.. system/admin/synaptic
were you able to install from there
i don't see an xchat package in this. it looks like a different package manager?
click settings/repositories
thats fine, are all the boxes checked? on the top under "download from the internet"
thus the problem,check them all
after checking them all, apply changes, then in synaptic, click "reload"
ok, this seems to be working. it's downloading about 45 files.
right, now, you can either search synaptic for xchat, and install it, or go to add/remove, or in a terminal, sudo apt-get install xchat
